intro: Eriocaulon boni, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a member of the Poales order and belongs to the family Eriocaulaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. Its flowering spikes are usually less than 10 centimeters tall, bearing tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are wind-pollinated. Eriocaulon boni plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic invertebrates.
